at the mouth of the Connecticut River. Families and tourists enjoy Old Saybrook's beaches, the high quality of restaurants, and the peaceful and  serene atmosphere. Many people travel from all over in their high class boats which they dock at the marina next to the ocean. Old Saybrook is where the Connecticut River meets Long Island Sound.

value: Description: The beautiful Lynde Light in Old Saybrook.

LOCATION
Middlesex County,
West Side of the Mouth of the Connecticut River,
45 miles from Hartford,
101 miles from New York,
105 miles from Boston,
Latitude 41° 17’ N. Longitude 72° 25’W.
Town Area – 18.3 square miles,
Total Town Roads – 72 miles,
It takes about 30 mintues by car to get from the airport to Old Saybrook.

value: -USA-RAIL. The station is open 5:15AM-10PM , Ticket sales end at 9:30PM.

The buses are called 9 Town Transit Service. Buses that run along the shoreline provide regular service along route 1 from Madison to Old Saybrook and all points in between. Its stops include Madison center, Hammonassett State Park, Clinton Crossings, Tangers Outlets, YMCA, Walmart, and the Old Saybrook Train Station.

The Riverside Shuttle provides regular service along route 154 from Old Saybrook to Essex, Deep River, and Chester. Regular stops will include the Old Saybrook Train station, Essex Square, Adam's Market, and the Center of Chester.
Old Saybrook is located off Interstate 95 at Exit 68. Old Saybrook is about 1 hour and 15 minutes to 1 hour and 45 minutes from Providence and 2 hours and 15 minutes from New York.
Old Saybrook is part of the 9 Transit Service which serves the Estuary Transit District. It has regular service Mon-Sat
and can be called for personalized service. +1 860 510-0429.
, Saybrook Point. 18 acres of beautiful woods owned by the Town of Old Saybrook. Storyboards "walk you around" and tell the story. Free.

content=Mid Jun to mid Sept. Sa,Su 1PM-4PM. Representing some of Connecticut's oldest architecture, this house was built in 1767 by a prominent citizen in Old Saybrooks history. Volunteer tour guides will take you around this elegant piece of American history. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places and home to the local historical society, this mansion features eight corner fireplaces. Award-winning historical gardens. $5.

Whether one desires to take a relaxing stroll on the beach, tour the ocean with a serene boat ride, take a look at fascinating antiques and even go shopping, Old Saybrook is perfect for an entertaining and memorable  experience.

value: , located on Rt. 154 in Old Saybrook; 345 Middlesex turnpike. Opened M-Su from 11-5; +1 860 388-0689. Enjoy this 120 dealer group shop featuring a complete collection of antiques & collectibles.
,Located on 1330 Boston Post Rd (Rt 1). Browse through vintage clothing and jewelry. Find anything from 1880 to 1970; Opened M-Sa 10:30-5. +1 860 395-1955.
The Mod Pod at Antiques Associates
, Located on 1450 Boston Post Rd in Old Saybrook (Rt 1). Enjoy the mid-century modern furnishings, lighting, paintings, and pottery; Opened from W-Su 11-5. +1 860 395-1930.
, Located on 998 Middlesex Turnpike in Old Saybrook, CT. +1 860 388-1934
,Located on 174 Main St. in Old Saybrook. Explore furnishings for homes, cottages and gardens. Opened daily except for Tue 10-5 and Sun 11-4. +1 860 395-0003.

, Located on 29 Plum Bank Rd in Old Saybrook. This small, shallow-water beach has a bathhouse with showers on-site. Visitors should contact the Old Saybrook Parks & Recreation Department at +1 860 395-3152 for up-to-date fee schedules. For more information, visit this website:

, Located on 105 Elm Street, Suite 16, Old Saybrook. +1 860 388-1713. Since 1982, this full-service jewelry store has been offering a wide range of fine and unique jewelry. They also have baby gifts, watches, and jewelry boxes. Services include jewelry repair, custom design and appraisals.

content=Located on Old Saybrook's historic Main Street, this store will cover all outdoor needs. North Cover Outfitters will have all clothing and equipment needs such as for sailing, yachting, hiking, and biking.
content=Plenty of boats to look at on site.

content=Visit your local Wal-Mart for every day low prices and a large selection of electronics, toys, video games, apparel, furniture, appliances, garden, sports, gifts, jewelry, cosmetics, media and more.

content=Old Glory, the largest selection of Music, Sports, Humor & Entertainment Apparel. Shop thousands at our stores & Over 50,000 items online at OldGlory.com. All Humor & Parody Tees Buy 2 Get 1 Free!

, Located on 1385 Boston Post Road in Old Saybrook. +1 860 388-1291. Action Sports carries an excellent selection of equipment, clothing, and accessories for skiing, snowboarding, biking, kayaking, and inline skating. Can't go wrong here!

Old Saybrook offers many different selections of restaurants and types of food. One can enjoy eating on the water or in town. Old Saybrook provides outstanding fresh seafood, Italian, and more.

value: content=Pizza is the specialty here at Alforno where it is very inexpensive. Lunch and dinner are only served along with only beer and wine. Hours: Sun.-Thu., noon-9PM Fri.-Sat., noon-10PM

content=An outdoor patio restaurant, mainly Tex-Mex food and a full bar, located by a small shopping center along Route 1. Hours are: Lunch, M-Sa, 11:30 to 3. Dinner nightly, 3 to 10 or 11. Sunday brunch, 11 to 2. Price Range: Entrées, $14.95 to $22.95.
content=Located right by the marina overlooking the water. Boats can dock right up to the restaurant.
content=Located on the water, an open air deck gives views of Long Island Sounds and the surrounding coastline.

content=Hours: Lunch, Tu-F 11:30 to 4. Dinner, Tu-Su, 5 to 10 or 11. Sunday brunch, 11:30 to 2. Price Ranges are: Starters: $7-$12, Entrées: $19-$32, Desserts: $7-$10. The bestsellers are Sesame-Crusted Tuna, Peking-Style Cornish Game Hen, Garlic and Ginger-Marinated Shrimp, Summer Tomato and Watermelon Salad. The cuisine style American/New, Bistro along with lunch and dinner served only.

content=Hours: Open for dinner Monday, Wednesday and Thursday, 5 to 10PM; Friday and Saturday, 5 to 11PM; and Sunday, 5 to 9PM Closed Tuesday. Opening for lunch soon (call for details). The bestsellers are Oysters, Scallops & Pecan Carmel Tart. Price Range: Starters, $7 to $11; sandwiches, $9.50 to $18; entrees, $17.50 to $22; desserts, $6 to $8.
content=Open daily for lunch and dinner and specialize in homemade Italian food. Daily pasta specials are a must to try.
content=Old style diner with the local touch. Their website has their menu. 6AM-Midnight 7 Days a Week

content=Voted Connecticut's Best Family Dining 9 years running. Serving breakfast, lunch, dinner & cocktails 6 Days a week 7AM to 9PM, and closed Wednesday. Seafood, meats & produce are delivered daily. Feast on the 20+ homemade pies, soups and daily specials from $3 - $15. Try the famous Clam Hash, Red Flannel Hash and Visit the Country gift shop located across the street. Price Range: Lunch entrees $3-$9; Dinner entrees $8-$15.

content=A formal and waterfront dining place in the Saybrook Point Inn & Spa. The L-shaped room wraps around an interior full bar, with windows looking on the Connecticut River beyond a marina. Lunch daily, 11:30 to 2. Dinner nightly, 6 to 9 or 10. Sunday brunch, 11 to 2. Price Range: Entrées, $21.95 to $33.95
content=Specializing is closely caught seafood from Long Island Sound. Try one of the fish specials, different each night. The local lobster is good and won't hurt your wallet.
, Located on 455 Boston Post Road in Old Saybrook. +1 860 388-3999. Enjoy this Chinese restaurant with a small but excellent sushi bar.
content=Located right at the Amtrak station (separate building) this restaurant is a must if you like pizza or trains.

Bars are very popular in this area. If you want to enjoy a cocktail with a friend or just sit and relax with a tasty drink, here are some places recommended in Old Saybrook.

value: content=A dining/bar in Old Saybrook that offers delicious drinks and meals.
content=A great Irish pub to enjoy a drink!
, Located on 15 Main St in Old Saybrook. +1 860 388-3133

, Located on 210 Main Street in Old Saybrook. This coffeehouse features gourmet coffees, teas, sandwiches, soups, salads, daily breakfast specials, desserts and baked goods. Contact information: +1 860 388-9718.

If your visiting Old Saybrook and need a place to stay. There are a number of hotels and motels in the area:

value: content=This hotel is located just 15 miles from the Groton-New London Airport and is minutes from the USS Nautilus, the Connecticut River Museum, Camelot Cruises, Gillette Castle State Park, the Mohegan Sun casino and the Mystic Aquarium & Institute For Exploration.
content=Provides great amenities for guests. Near the Essex Steam Train and Riverboat Ride, Florence Griswold Museum, Gillette Castle, and Hammonassett State Beach.

content=Close to all local all day attractions, restaurants, shopping malls, and plazas. Enjoy a relaxing 1/2 acre pond with a large fountain and gazebo area which is perfect for wedding, family, or any other gathering event.

content=This hotel has many attractions to offer nearby: Mystic Seaport & Aquarium, Casinos, Beaches & Golf, Outlet Malls, Antiques, Children's Museum, Marina's Ferry, Historic Essex, Steam Train & River Boat Rides, Gillette Castle, USS Crocker Memorial.

content=Offers room service, restaurant on site, fitness center, spa, sauna, bar/lounge, fully air-conditioned, non-smoking rooms available, smoking rooms available, pool. Rate Range: from $145 to $470 per night.
content=A comfortable lodging inn with beautiful rooms which is close to many attractions including the train station, shopping centers, and restaurants.
directions=exit 66 of I-95 left onto Rt. 1

content=A small motel run by a local family, stressing economical, no frills, clean, and comfortable accomodations. A step above the chains and wanabees in service and authentic local and regional knowledge. Call the chamber of commerce (860)388-3266 or read the online reviews, this is the real deal.
